answers.answer: Since you have a negative HIV test, you can be certain you don't have HIV.  Many women get recurrent yeast infections.  She needs to follow through with her gynecologist, but otherwise I have no particular advice for you.Good luck--  HHH, MD

Sorry to add on further info I hope you read this before answering.It has been about a year and a half since exposure that I mentioned. From what I've read it seem that normally yeast problems in HIV positive people happen in that second stage i.e. more than a few months after exposure as her first infecton was only a few months after exposure.Is there any STD's that would be confused so many times as yeas infecton even been help / cured for a time by the meds I mentioned.

Hi,maybe she is becoming resistant to the medication because she is using it so often.  She should try eating yogurt.  It prevents yeast infections.  I know that HIV is associated with recurrent yeast infections, but so is diabetes, thyroid disorders, pregnancy, etc.  Not a doc, by the way.Pan
The additional information doesn't change my response.  There are no STDs that are likely to be confused with yeast infections by your wife's health care provders over such a long time.HHH, MD

Thanks again for your time. Ofcorse our main concern was HIV som thanks for putting that to rest.As for the yeas infecton is it correct that the symptoms of that in hiv positive people would so up later on rather than a few weeks to a month after infection.

question: my question has a few parts. First I was tested for Hiv at least 4 weeks after exposure (unprotected oral sex, protected vaginal sex)probably longer but I cant remember exactly. 4 weeks later my wife was tested. Both were negitive. Since she has had multible yeas infectons (around 6 or 8 in the past year) treated by cream and months of difleucan. After months of symptom free while on difleucan the symptoms came back 1 month after last pill was taking , she went to gyno and was diagnosed as yeast infection. Was told that alot of things could cause this including hiv.No sex outside of the relationship has happend except that which was mentioned. They took blood from her to "run tests" which I think include hiv and this has started my mind wondering.Should I be concerned about HIV ?
title: yeas infectons
